transaction.updateFailed: Update failed, please try again later
transaction.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this record? This action cannot be undone.
transaction.deleteFailed: Delete failed, please try again later
transaction.deleteWarning: Cannot be undone after deletion, please proceed with caution
transaction.autoGenExample: Example: Leaving blank will auto-generate '12/16 Semester Update'
transaction.startingBalanceExample: Example: If you actually have $50, fill in 50. If starting from zero, fill in 0.
transaction.resetNote1: ‚Ä¢ After settlement, accumulated rewards will be recalculated from this point
transaction.resetNote2: ‚Ä¢ You can set a starting balance (actual amount held)
transaction.resetNote3: ‚Ä¢ Event name can be left blank, system will auto-generate 'Date + Category'
transaction.resetNote4: ‚Ä¢ Settlement records on the same day are treated as the last event of that day
transaction.resetNote5: ‚Ä¢ Suitable for recalibrating reward amounts or starting a new semester
transaction.resetWarning: If there are other income/expense records on the same day, the system will automatically treat the settlement record as the last event of that day, so records earlier than the settlement will not be included in statistics.
transaction.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this record?
transaction.description: Record {name}'s reward income and expense details
transaction.resetInfo1: After settlement, accumulated rewards will start calculating from this point
transaction.resetInfo2: You can set the starting balance after settlement (actual amount held)
transaction.resetInfo3: Event name can be left blank, system will auto-generate 'date + category'
transaction.resetInfo4: Settlement records on the same day will be treated as the last event of that day
transaction.resetInfo5: Suitable for recalibrating reward amounts or starting a new semester
transaction.resetInfo6: Will not affect previous records, just changes the calculation starting point
transaction.resetWarning: If there are other income/expense records on the same day, the system will automatically treat the settlement record as the last event of that day, so records before the settlement will not be included in statistics.
transaction.resetIsLast: This settlement record is treated as the last event of the day, records before this are not included in statistics
transaction.statsFrom: Statistics calculated from the day after settlement ({date})
transaction.selectOtherMonthOrAdd: Select another month or add new records
transaction.clickToAddRecord: Click '‚ûï Add Record' in the top right to start recording

rewardRules.title: Reward Rules Management
rewardRules.noExclusiveRules: No exclusive rules yet, exclusive rules have the highest priority
rewardRules.ruleInfo1: Exclusive Rules: Only applies to this subject for this student (highest priority)
rewardRules.ruleInfo2: Student Rules: Applies to all subjects for this student
rewardRules.ruleInfo3: Global Rules: Applies to all subjects for all students
rewardRules.cannotEditStudent: Student rules must be managed on the student page
rewardRules.cannotEditGlobal: Global rules must be managed in system settings
rewardRules.prioritySuggestion: Suggestion: Exclusive rules 40, Subject rules 30, Student rules 20, Global rules 10
rewardRules.subjectOnlyRule: Subject Rule (Applies to all students taking {subjectIcon} {subjectName})
rewardRules.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the rule "{ruleName}"? This action cannot be undone!
rewardRules.deleteFailed: Failed to delete, please try again later
rewardRules.studentRuleScopeDesc: Only applies to all subjects for this student
rewardRules.globalRuleScopeDesc: Applies to all students and all subjects
rewardRules.rulePriorityIntro: The system will search for matching rules in the following order:
rewardRules.rulePriorityNote: ‚ö° Within the same rule type, you can adjust the matching order using the reorder button
rewardRules.priorityExplanation1: Exclusive Rules (Specific Student + Specific Subject) - Highest Priority
rewardRules.priorityExplanation2: Subject Rules (All students of a specific subject)
rewardRules.priorityExplanation3: Student Rules (All subjects of a specific student)
rewardRules.priorityExplanation4: Global Rules (All students, all subjects) - Lowest Priority
rewardRules.priorityExplanation5: ‚ö° The system will automatically select the highest priority matching rule to award points
rewardRules.autoGenerateRuleName: Leave blank to auto-generate: Subject Score Reward
rewardRules.autoGenerateRuleNameHint: Leave blank to auto-generate, e.g., Math 90 pts Reward
rewardRules.subjectOnlyRulesNote: These rules apply to all students learning {subjectName}
rewardRules.setGlobalRulesFor: Set reward rules for {subjectName} that apply to all students
rewardRules.globalSubjectRulesNote: These rules will apply to all students learning this subject
rewardRules.clickAboveToAdd: Click the button above to add
rewardRules.studentRulesNote: These rules apply to all subjects for {studentName} and cannot be edited here
rewardRules.globalRulesNote: These rules apply to all subjects for all students and cannot be edited here
rewardRules.priorityIntro: When a student completes an assessment, the system will select reward rules in the following order:
rewardRules.assessmentTypeHint: Select a specific type to give different rewards for different assessments (e.g. higher rewards for major exams)
rewardRules.rewardFormulaHint: Enter a number or a formula. Vars: G=score, P=percentage, M=max score (e.g., G*10)

settings.title: System Settings
settings.siteNameDesc: Customize the title displayed on the homepage
settings.paginationDesc: Set the number of items per page for assessment records and transaction lists
settings.paginationRangeError: Items per page must be between {min} and {max}
settings.paginationPreview: Assessment records and transaction lists will display {count} items per page
settings.paginationPreviewUnlimited: Assessment records and transaction lists will display all records (no pagination)
settings.backupDesc: Backup or restore all website data, including students, subjects, assessments, reward passbook, reward rules, and site settings
settings.exportBackupDesc: Download a complete database backup file (JSON format)
settings.importBackupDesc: Restore all data from a backup file (will overwrite existing data)
settings.backupFileInvalidFormat: Please select a backup file in JSON format
settings.backupConfirmMessage: Importing backup will overwrite all existing data. This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?
settings.backupSaveToDBDesc: Save backup to database for easy restoration later without downloading files

clearAllStudents.title: Delete All Student Data
clearAllStudents.description: This will delete all students, subjects, assessments, passbook transactions, and reward rules, but will keep homepage settings (site name, pagination settings, etc.).
clearAllStudents.backupSuggestionTitle: Suggestion: Back up data before proceeding
clearAllStudents.backupSuggestionDesc: You can use the "Data Backup" section above to back up all data for restoring later.
clearAllStudents.confirmMessage:
Are you sure you want to delete all student data?

This will delete:
‚Ä¢ All students
‚Ä¢ All subjects
‚Ä¢ All assessments
‚Ä¢ All passbook transactions
‚Ä¢ All reward rules

‚ö†Ô∏è This action cannot be undone!

Homepage settings (site name, pagination settings, etc.) will be kept.
clearAllStudents.confirmPrompt: Type "{text}" to confirm deleting all student data:
clearAllStudents.confirmTextMismatch: Confirmation text is incorrect. Operation cancelled.

settings.backupNamePlaceholder: e.g., Auto Backup-2024-01-15 (leave empty to auto-generate)
settings.backupDescriptionPlaceholder: Optional: Describe the purpose or content of this backup
settings.backupDeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this backup

clear.sectionDesc: The actions below will delete the student's records but keep the student's settings. Please proceed with caution.

validation.selectStartEndDates: Please select a start and end date
validation.startAfterEnd: Start date cannot be later than end date

transactions.range: Delete passbook transactions in date range

assessments.all: Are you sure you want to delete all assessments? This action cannot be undone.
assessments.range: Are you sure you want to delete assessments from {start} to {end}? This action cannot be undone.

transactions.all: Are you sure you want to delete all passbook transactions? This action cannot be undone.
transactions.range: Are you sure you want to delete passbook transactions from {start} to {end}? This action cannot be undone.

subjects.all: Are you sure you want to delete all subjects? This will also delete related assessment records. This action cannot be undone.

all.all: Are you sure you want to clear all records? This will delete all assessments, passbook transactions, subjects, and reward rules, while keeping only the student settings. This action cannot be undone.
all.range: Are you sure you want to clear all records from {start} to {end}? This will delete assessments and passbook transactions in that period, while keeping only the student settings. This action cannot be undone.
